chargeHist.descr: Neglecting a Child (No Harm and Child < 6 Yrs or Disability)

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Neglecting a Child (No Harm and Child < 6 Yrs or Disability)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Debra L. Rebello

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Debra L. Rebello appeared by video.  Attorney Ian Mickelson in court for Debra L. Rebello.  Attorney Lisa Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin. Per Attorney Mickelson, an offer will be accepted pending payment of restitution. Continuance requested for defendant to obtain restitution. Offer requires payment of restitution of $650. Court orders defendant to pay $100 per month to Clerk of Court to be held in trust for restitution. Court continues status for review of payments. If at least $300 has been deposited, defendant may appear by video or phone. If not, appear in person.
Status conference scheduled for January 18, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on January 18, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Debra L. Rebello in court.  Attorney Ian Mickelson in court for Debra L. Rebello.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Amy Hartwig sworn and testified. Exhibit #1: Report- offered and received. Cross. Attorney Pozorksi heard and requests bind over. Attorney Mickelson heard and objects to bind over. Court heard and binds matter over. Information filed. Defendant waives formal reading and pleads not guilty. Status date set.
Status conference scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on October 26, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 13, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Debra L. Rebello in court.  Attorney Ian Mickelson in court for Debra L. Rebello.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Court explains charges, penalties, and right to counsel. Attorney Mickelson has been appointed. State requests a signature bond. Court heard and orders $1000 signature bond. Preliminary hearing set.
